intro: Phoradendron brachystachyum, commonly known as the short-stalked mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that attaches to the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its dense, leafy foliage and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces fleshy, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for various bird species. Its growth is dependent on the host tree for both physical support and nutrients. Phoradendron brachystachyum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Central and South America.
